intro: Tetrorchidium ulugurense, commonly known as the Uluguru tetrorchidium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Uluguru Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid climate of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
